column4: My system is apparently corrupted. I cannot load Synaptic nor update manager. Please help.
I have the update icon showint in my sys tray, but I cannot connect. Why?
some of the servers are overloaded at this time.. may want ty try again later/tomorrow
I have tried since yesterday, the screen doesn't open. Also, synaptic won't open. I had a quick power outage that I think may have fouled my system.
ugh. may want to boot a live cd. and fsck the drives to verify they are all 'ok'
I upgraded from Badger to Dapper over the internet, can I use the Badger cd to do this?
i dont even rember what the badgercd can do.. you really should track down a newer livecd.
Can this be performed from terminal?
fscking from a system you booted from/with mounted filesystems. is not a good idea.  thus the need for a live cd.
i got a stack of little live cds i keep for just such an emergancy. I boot them, use fsck /dev/whatever as needed (rarely ever need to do this) but yours is a special case
can I download a live cd from the internet or do I have to find an outside source to order/purchase one?
theres 100's of them you can download.
may want to check out 'slax' or 'puppylinux' or 'dsl'  live cd's
plus theres the official ubuntu live cd's
Ok. Thanks again. Live ubuntu cd's would be at the support sight someplace? Yes? (Only a newbie would ask, right? lol )
Thanks again for your help. Have a good day. bye all
